Class FlexiblePortfolioModel

java.lang.Object
Model
FlexiblePortfolioModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface, ModelInterface
public class FlexiblePortfolioModel extends Model implements FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
The FlexiblePortfolioModel class represents a model for managing flexible portfolios. It implements the FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface, providing methods to create, load, save, and perform various operations on portfolios.

    • createPortfolio

      public void createPortfolio​(String portfolioName, String[] tickerSymbols, float[] stockAmounts) throws IllegalArgumentException
      createPortfolio has changed slightly compared to the version from Assignment 4. The difference is that the logic for checking if a ticker symbol is a valid stock has been abstracted away into a helper function called isValidTicker. This is different from isValidTicker in Assignment 4, which could only check validity in certain cases, and the old method is used as a helper for the new isValidTicker. The new method is a general function that any method in Model can use to determine if a ticker symbol is valid. This is an improvement over the original design because functionality that is required for many parts of the program, determining if a ticker symbol is valid, is now in a separate method, and createPortfolio does not duplicate code in this new method.
      Specified by:
      createPortfolio in interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Specified by:
      createPortfolio in interface ModelInterface
      Overrides:
      createPortfolio in class Model
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of the portfolio to be created.
      tickerSymbols - a String array of ticker symbols.
      stockAmounts - in the order of the stocks specified in tickerSymbols, says how many of each stock to add to the portfolio.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • purchaseShares

      public void purchaseShares​(String portfolioName, String tickerSymbol, String date, int numShares) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Purchase a specified number of shares of a stock with the given ticker symbol for the specified portfolio and date. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the portfolio is not found.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - The name of the portfolio where the shares will be purchased.
      tickerSymbol - The ticker symbol of the stock to be purchased.
      date - The date of the purchase.
      numShares - The number of shares to be purchased.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified portfolio is not found.

    • purchaseShares

      public String purchaseShares​(String portfolioName, String tickerSymbol, String date, float numShares) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Purchases a specified number of shares of a stock in the specified portfolio on the given date.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - The name of the portfolio in which to purchase the shares.
      tickerSymbol - The ticker symbol of the stock to purchase.
      date - The date of the purchase in MM/DD/YYYY format.
      numShares - The number of shares to purchase.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success of the purchase operation.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified portfolio does not exist.

    • sellShares

      public void sellShares​(String portfolioName, String tickerSymbol, String date, int numShares) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sell a specified number of shares of a stock with the given ticker symbol from the specified portfolio and date. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the portfolio is not found.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - The name of the portfolio from which the shares will be sold.
      tickerSymbol - The ticker symbol of the stock to be sold.
      date - The date of the sale.
      numShares - The number of shares to be sold.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified portfolio is not found.

    • movingAverage

      public float movingAverage​(int numDays, String tickerSymbol, String date)
      Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Calculates the average price for the given stock in the last x days, starting from the given date. It includes the last x days for which stock prices are available.
      Specified by:
      movingAverage in interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Parameters:
      numDays - x in the x-day moving average
      tickerSymbol - the stock to calculate the average for
      date - the last date of the desired period, in MM/DD/YYYY
      Returns:
      the average stock price of the given period

    • findCrossovers

      public String findCrossovers​(String tickerSymbol, String startDateString, String endDateString) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Returns a list of the positive crossovers and negative crossovers within the given time period.
      Specified by:
      findCrossovers in interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the stock to check for crossovers
      startDateString - the start date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      endDateString - the end date of the period to check (in MM/DD/YYYY format)
      Returns:
      a string listing the positive and negative crossovers. For the View to parse into the final printed output.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if given an invalid ticker symbol

    • findMovingCrossovers

      public String findMovingCrossovers​(String tickerSymbol, String startDateString, String endDateString, int x, int y) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Finds moving average crossovers for a given ticker symbol within a specified date range.
      Specified by:
      findMovingCrossovers in interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - The ticker symbol of the stock.
      startDateString - The start date of the date range in the format "M/d/yyyy".
      endDateString - The end date of the date range in the format "M/d/yyyy".
      x - The number of days for the first moving average.
      y - The number of days for the second moving average.
      Returns:
      A string containing positive and negative crossover dates separated by commas.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the end date is before the start date or if the ticker symbol is invalid.

    • chartPerformance

      public String chartPerformance​(String portfolioName, String startDate, String endDate)
      Description copied from interface: FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Creates a horizontal bar chart of the performance of a portfolio over time. It has bars for regular time intervals from startDate to endDate, and the bar is made up of asterisks, with each asterisk representing the number of dollars indicated in the scale.
      Specified by:
      chartPerformance in interface FlexiblePortfolioModelInterface
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the portfolio to chart the performance for
      startDate - the beginning of the time period to be included in the graph
      endDate - the end of the time period to be included in the graph
      Returns:
      the final graph as text

    • getStockPriceForDollarCost

      protected float getStockPriceForDollarCost​(String tickerSymbol, String date, Model.TypeOfPrice typeOfPrice)
      Returns the value of the given stock on the given date, or if there is no data for the given date, the value on the last date before the given date.
      Parameters:
      tickerSymbol - the ticker symbol of the stock to look up
      date - the date for which you want the value, in MM/DD/YYYY
      Returns:
      the value of the stock on that day.

    • investFixedAmount

      public String investFixedAmount​(String portfolioName, float amount, String date, Map<String,​Float> weightDistribution)
      Invests a fixed amount of money into a portfolio according to a given weight distribution.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of the portfolio to invest in
      amount - the total amount of money to invest
      date - the date of investment
      weightDistribution - a map representing the weight distribution of the investment, where keys are ticker symbols and values are corresponding weights
      Returns:
      a string indicating the result of the investment operation

    • calculateNumShares

      public float[] calculateNumShares​(float amount, Map<String,​Float> weightDistribution, String date)
      Helper method to calculate the number of shares to be purchased for each stock based on the weight distribution and the investment amount.
      Parameters:
      weightDistribution - Map containing the weight distribution for each stock.
      amount - Amount to be invested.
      date - Date for which the prices are considered.
      Returns:
      Array containing ticker symbols as keys and the corresponding number of shares as values.

    • dollarCostAveraging

      public String dollarCostAveraging​(String portfolioName, float amount, String startDate, String endDate, int frequency, Map<String,​Float> weightDistribution)
      Performs dollar-cost averaging by periodically investing a fixed amount of money into a portfolio.
      Parameters:
      portfolioName - the name of the portfolio to invest in
      amount - the total amount of money to invest per period
      startDate - the start date of the dollar-cost averaging strategy
      endDate - the end date of the dollar-cost averaging strategy (optional, use null for current date)
      frequency - the frequency of investment periods (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly)
      weightDistribution - a map representing the weight distribution of the investment, where keys are ticker symbols and values are corresponding weights
      Returns:
      a string indicating the result of the dollar-cost averaging operation
